page.title: 13FLAKEBRIDGE PHEASANT SHOOT
page.content: The owner invites friends to 8 shoots a season.A bag of 150 pheasants & 9 woodcock is good.The men eat in the keepers home.Beaters bring sandwiches. Guns eat in a big room kept for the purpose.The keeper's wife lights a fire,lays the table & washes up,but hot food comes by taxi from the host's home.The keeper rears pheasants by hand,to release in the wood,feeds adult birds all year,which suits the wildlife like red squirrels & roe deer.The pheasants also attract buzz- ards & sparrow hawks,which frighten them.Mink are increasing.The keeper kills vermin, & watches for poachers after dark,& all day in Fair Week.The farmers are a help.The shoot extends over their land where live snipe,duck & partridge.Timber work can upset birds & they will not do well if firs replace deciduous trees for ever.
